Hudson Street, northernmost block, 13th to 14th Streets.
March 12, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, a month later, giving a better view of the west side.
April 20, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

Hudson Street, northernmost block, 13th to 14th Streets.

(2)

April 20, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

Hudson Street, west side, from 13th to Gansevoort Streets.
April 10, 1934
P.L. Sperr

(1)
Hudson Street, west side, north of and including West 13th Street, showing the Herring Building occupying the triangular area caused by the convergence of Hudson Street and Ninth Ave. (elevated line thereon) at 14th Street. At the latter point appears a station bearing that designation. The vacant lot shown was caused by the demolition of the 7-story Wing Building. Across this is seen the 6-story Rich Building. Shown on the right (flag atop) is a portion of the National Biscuit Co. plant; this portion being at the N.W. corner of Ninth Ave. and West 15th
Street.
April 10, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing the area in the same condition.
April 17, 1937.

(1)
Hudson Street, west side, north of and including West 13th Street, showing the Herring Building occupying the triangular area caused by the convergence of Hudson Street and Ninth Ave. (elevated line thereon) at 14th Street. At the latter point appears a station bearing that designation. The vacant lot shown was caused by the demolition of the 7-story Wing Building. Across this is seen the 6-story Rich Building. Shown on the right (flag atop) is a portion of the National Biscuit Co. plant; this portion being at the N.W. corner of Ninth Ave. and West 15th
Street.
April 10, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing the area in the same condition.
April 17, 1937.

(1)
335 to 307 West 13th Street (left to right) north side, between Hudson Street and Eighth Ave., as seen from Gansevoort Street. St. Bernards Parochial School is No. 335-327 and appears on the left.

April 7, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.
Neg. #2626

(2)
A view showing mainly the School. The small 4-story structure adjoining same is No. 325.

April 17, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
A detail, showing Nos. 325 to 315. The 7-story loft shown is occupied by the Supply, Printing and Publishing Department's of the Salvation Army.

April 17, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

April 17, 1937.

Newton Building, Hudson Street at 13th Street, the N.E. corner
seen from the clearing on the S.W. corner.
April 10. 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

Hudson Street,south of 13th Street. On the south east side a garage is located,on the south west the Trio Building.
August 12th,1940
P.L.Sperr,
No reproductions.
